result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher S Ryerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fines, costs, and surcharges shall be paid at the rate of $100 per month commencing February 1, 2016 or judgment shall enter for nonpayment.   There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher S Ryerson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  On a plea to ct 1, state moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2 & 3, Court so orders;   Guilty plea entered on Ct 1; Court finds def guilty on Ct.1; Argument from State, Defense; Court proceeds to sentencing. Court imposes a fine of $642 to be paid at the rate of $100 per month comm 2/1/16 or judgment shall enter.   Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State. Req. adj. to attempt resolution. If not resolved on adj date set for trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Per request of Atty. Gary Schmaus, 11-04-15 Hearing rescheduled to 11-18-15 at 8:15 a.m.
Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Offer pending.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Off the record adjournment given to counsel; 9-02-15 Hearing rescheduled to 9-21-15 at 2:30 p.m.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State. Defendant indicates not eligible for public defender representation - advised was told this via phone. Court orders defendant go to the Public Defender's Office and complete the paperwork to determine if qualifies for public defender representation.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Alyssa Armbrust from State Public Defender Office.  Intern Samuel Tufford with Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for the State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Argument on bond.  State requests cash bond.  $1,000 signature bond set.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
